description: Court-Martial starring Sonic, Princess Sally Acorn, Antoine D'Coolette, Bunny Rabbot, Amy Rose, Dr. Robotnik, Nack The Weasel, Rotor, and Tails, script by Michael Gallagher, pencils by Dave Manak, inks by Rich Koslowski; Sonic is held for trial for betraying the Freedom Fighters to Dr. Robotnik.
name: Court-Martial

description: ...And One Shall Save Him!, script by Ken Penders, pencils by Kyle Hunter, inks by Harvey Mercadoocasio [as HARVO]; Sonic, Sally and Geoffrey venture into the Zone Of Silence to retrieve the exiled King Acorn before the anomaly collapses in on itself.
name: ...and One Shall Save Him!

description:
In Every Kingdom There Must Exist A Little Chaos, script by Kent Taylor, pencils by Art Mawhinney, inks by Phil Sheehy; Sonic, Tails and Sally try to assemble as many Chaos Emeralds and Magic Rings as possible to use the energy to cure an afflicted King Acorn. Knuckles' Quest, script by Ken Penders and Kent Taylor, pencils by Art Mawhinney, inks by Brian Thomas; Knuckles and Tails travel to Downunda seeking King Acorn's enchanted sword.

"IN EVERY KINGDOM MUST EXIST A LITTLE CHAOS!": Freedom Fighters seek to cure the King Acorn

Knuckles Quest: Knuckles travels with Tails in order to cure the King Acorn

While King Acorn undergoes treatment to stem his body from crystallizing, Sonic must enter his dreams to give him the will to live.

The Dream ZONE: sonic travel in King Acorn's dream in order to wake him

Black and Blue and Red All Over: One day Anti Sonic and new character Anti Knuckles try to steal the master emerald from Knuckles. They Eventually get in a fight with Sonic, Tails, Sally & Knuckles. But then they all team up to stop Dr. Robotnik. In the end, the master emerald is returned to it's rightful owner and Anti Knuckles becomes a good guy.

Guerilla Thriller: the free fighters have been captured guerilla force while robotnik has new device prepare to destroy their base

Knuckles quest part three: A Land of Dark a Knight if virtue: Knuckles is controled by a sorcereress and echantress
name: Guerrilla Thriller; Knuckles Quest 3: A Land of Dark, A Knight of Virtue
Countdown To Armageddon - Part 1

description: In what was meant to be a routine mission, something goes terribly wrong and Princess Sally is critically wounded. All evidence pins Sally's would-be murderer as none other than Sonic the Hedgehog, whom arrives back at Knothole only to be arrested by the Royal Guard. Though everybody saw Sonic deliberately try and kill Princess Sally, Sonic maintains his innocence, but the evidence against him says otherwise.
name: Endgame - Part 1 of 4

description: As he is being escorted to prison by the Royal Guard, Sonic seizes an opportunity to escape incarceration, determined to prove he was not responsible for the accident that may have killed Princess Sally. Meanwhile, the rest of the freedom fighters debate whether or not Sonic may be a murderer - or who among them is the traitor that may have framed him. As if right on cue, King Acorn announces a proposed partnership with Dr. Robotnik, who quickly swoops in to capture residents of the Knothole Freedom Fighter base.
name: Endgame - Part 2 of 4

description:
Still on the run from the law, Sonic the Hedgehog is unaware that Dr. Robotnik has orchestrated this entire sequence of events from the beginning. Robotnik reveals to the now-captured Knothole village that the King Acorn they've been trusting has been a robotic duplicate all along. In typical villainous fashion, Robotnik gloats over the helpless Knothole village, allowing them the pleasure of living long enough to be obliterated by his brand new super-weapon: The Ultimate Annihilator, a devastating satellite-mounted laser cannon that erases matter at an atomic level.

Back at Knothole, the true traitor is revealed: Drago, of the Wolf Pack. Drago tricked another freedom fighter named Hershey in to disguising herself as Sonic. Hershey thought she was killing Snively, Dr. Robotnik's right-hand man - but the mask she wore alters her vision so that everyone she sees at look like Snively, including Princess Sally.
name: Endgame - Part 3 of 4

description:
Sonic now finds himself on The Floating Island, between captain of the Royal Guard Geoffry St. Jon and guardian of the Floating Island Knuckles the Echidna. A three-way battle ensues between them before Sonic is finally captured by a cloaked Espio the Chameleon. Sonic is bailed out by Dulcy the Dragon, who reveals that it is physically impossible for Dragons to tell lies - making her a living lie-detector. She informs Knuckles and Geoffry that yes, Sonic is telling the truth about his innocence.

The trio head back to Knothole where they discover Dr. Robotnik's scheme. After freeing the Freedom Fighters and taking the traitorous Drago in to custody, Sonic speeds off to Robotropolis to confront Dr. Robotnik in person and make him pay for what's happened to the Princess.

Forgoing the typical pleasantries, the pair fight hand-to-hand in Robotnik's cramped command center. Sonic and Robotnik are matching each other blow-for-blow, completely thrashing the control room. The battle is temporarily broken up by the destruction of Robotnik's Ultimate Annihilator weapon - sabotage by Freedom Fighters who followed Sonic to Robotropolis. The explosion triggers a matter-erasing singularity that engulfs the control room, taking Sonic and Robotnik with it. Once the smoke clears, however, Sonic discovers he has mysteriously survived - although Robotnik has not. Bewildered, he returns to Knothole Village to be greeted by Princess Sally, who has pulled through and made a full recovery.
name: Endgame - Part 4 of 4
Unfinished Business
Monkey Madness; Rise of the Robians
Back to the Basics ...or the History Device
Opposites Detract; The People's Princess
Arsenal of the Iron King; The Ultimatum

description: Sonic and Tails join the Downunda Freedom Fighters to find out what is happening to Duck Platabus. St. John formed up a team for the king’s service.
name: Outback Gut Check; On His Majesty's Secret Service

description:
It's Sonic's 16th birthday, but the day isn't as Sweet as he thought it would be as Snively takes over one of Mobius's Satellites and sends Sonic some Meteors.

Tales of the Freedom Fighters- Lupe and her Pack come across something on their way home
name: Surprise/ Tales Of The Freedom Fighters - Part 2: Survival Of The Fittest

description:
A day in The Life: The vigil beside Queen Alicia's bed-side continues in peace- or so Sonic and The Freedom Fighters think. They are being stalked by a mysterious enemy what will make their presence known by the end of the issue. And wait until you find out what they want.

Tales of the Freedom Fighters: Lupe decides what to due with the two Overlander girls.
name: A Day In The Life/ Tales Of The Freedom Fighters - Part 3 - Weathering The Storm

description: Nate Morgan has been kidnapped by Kodos and his bands of Modius criminals. Sonic and the King's Secret Service are sent to rescue him, but will Geoffrey get over his hatred of Overlanders to save Nate?

"Don't Call It A Comeback!": The intrigue continues as Sonic and the Freedom Fighters return to Knothole Village to find only his parents there! Where did everyone else go?! Fed up, Sonic and his pals take off for outer space in search of answers... and the culprit behind their friends' disappearance! But once they find out who the village-napper is, they may wish they'd never asked!

In this issue-length nail-biter, "I Am The Eggman," Dr. Robotnik is back, and he's carrying a whole new bag of tricks and surprises! For starters, he's imprisoned Sonic and The Freedom Fighters, and he intends to roboticize them! Isn't this where we all came in?!?!

"Business As Usual": A mass exodus to Knothole Village is underway for the frightened Mobians, who once again must face the threat of the recently-returned Robotnik! The only problem is, Robotnik may have a computer file on Knothole's exact location. Can Sonic and the Freedom Fighters find and destroy the file before the citizens of Mobius are roboticized? It won't be easy, with all the Shadow Bots on their trail! But an unlikely ally named Snively just might hold the key to victory... for now! Plus: Part four of "Tales of the Great War" by Ken Penders, Chris Allan, & Jim Amash, continues the thrilling series of back-up stories chronicling important events in Sonic mythology!
name: Dr. Robotnik Returns!

description: "Rebel Without A Pause": Sonic and Sally tirelessly continue their crusade against Dr. Robotnik, even if it goes against King Max's wishes! After their latest escapades, he orders Sonic to his chambers. What fate awaits him? Meanwhile, Sally has a tearful reunion of sorts with Alicia, who sleeps peacefully in her cryogenic tube. And what's this lurking on the horizon? Could Overlander vessels be heading for Mobius? Plus: "For Better Or For Worse", the Tales From the Great War saga continues as Sonic's parents recall the fateful days leading up to their tragic fate.
name: Homecoming

description: CHANGES: It's a defining moment for Sonic and his friends as Sonic is finally knighted, and King Max declares the formation of the Kingdom of Knothole, a state that will serve as a haven for all Mobians who wish to live free of Robotnik's tyranny! Furthermore, he also announces the reformation of the Knothole Freedom Fighters, officially sanctioned to serve in conjunction with Geoffrey's Secret Service Team to keep the peace! And a fragile peace it is, as Robotnik and his charges still lurk about, plotting their revenge against Sonic! As if that wasn't enough, in his quest to fortify his computer for his latest onslaught, Robotnik finds and launches a file that will ultimately tie into our upcoming adaptation of the Sega Dreamcast game! And wait until you learn the identity of his new first lieutenant!!!

Inspired by the popular "Sonic Adventure" game for the hot Sega "Dreamcast" platform! When Nate Morgan uses his telecrate technology to infiltrate Dr. Robotnik's computer network, he receives transmissions that send shivers down the Freedom Fighter's spines: the dastardly Doc has ordered an excavation somewhere near the mysterious Cat County, leading them to believe he may have found the Hidden City of the Ancients! Nate and The Freedom Fighters are immediately dispatched to quell the threat, all that is, except for Amy Rose, who the others feel is too young. Amy is outraged, Tails is allowed to go on the mission, and he's the same age as her! Will that stop her? Heck, no! Amy calls upon the powers of the Ring of Acorns to make herself older, transforming herself into her "Dreamcast" counterpart, and depleting the ring of all its energy in the process! The price is a harsh one, as the ring has been used in the service of healing the Queen. Fearing ill effects, Nate insists Amy comes along on the mission with them. Can they survive Amy's amazing transformation? For that matter, can Amy?! It's a journey of discovery that will lead our fearless heroes to the startling new world depicted in the Sonic Adventure Dreamcast game! PLUS: The senses-shattering conclusion to the epic "Tales of the Great War" back-up series by Ken Penders, Chris Allan, and Jim Amash.

A special issue inspired by the popular new Sonic Adventure game for the hot Sega Dreamcast system! After their amazing journey in issue #79, the Freedom Fighters find themselves in an ancient city that is a brave new world to them. Filled with five-fingered Overlanders who call themselves "humans," the furry friends are given a warm welcome a la "Escape From The Planet Of The Apes", the heroes receive a tour of the city, Amy goes shopping, Tails flies his plane, etc. But all is not right here, and true to form, Sonic's restless spirit finds him on night patrol, where his curiosity inevitably leads him to trouble and feats of daring do! The action continues in Sonic Super Special #13, shipping January 2000!

Continuing our special tie-in tales with Sega's mega-successful "Sonic Adventure" Dreamcast Game! "City Of Dreams": The mysteries of the Hidden City of The Ancients continue to obsess our heroes: Are the citizens of this pocket environment hostile or friendly? Could they be the answer to Planet Mobius' secret origin? Will Sonic and the others from Knothole Village be ambassadors of peace or will they be forced to mobilize for conflict? Also: "All You Need Is A Bit Of Chaos" (by Penders, Butler, & Eklund): In pursuit of the evil Dr. Robotnik (who stole shards of the Master Emerald), Knuckles follows him deep into the mysterious Cat Country where he finds the Mystic Ruins. Time is running out as the grounded Floating Island has been invaded by the Cat People! Plus: "A Rose By Any Other Name" (by Chris Allan & Harvey Mercadoocasio): In this solo story, Amy Rose gets used to her new body and... her new powers?!

Continuing our special tie-tin tales with Sega's mega-successful Sonic Adventure Dreamcast Game! "Night Of Chaos": Having been accepted as celebrities in the Hidden City Of The Ancients, Sonic plays super-hero and patrols the streets of Station Square. But can he and his friends survive the menace that lurks in the night?! "A Door To The Past": As Knuckles explores the Mystic Ruins for shards of the Master Emerald, he is floored by a mysterious vision of the past showing another side of the echidna race. Can Knuckles handle it? By Ken Penders, Steven Butler, and Pam Eklund. "Double-Crossed Circuits": A thrilling solo story featuring E-102 "Gamma" from the Sonic Adventure game ? setting the stage for next month's Sonic Super Special #13!

Continuing our special tie-in tales with Sega's mega-successful Sonic Adventure Dreamcast game! What's going on here? Tails's latest plane is missing, but this one's got a tracking device, leading Sonic and Tails on a frantic flight to the Mystic Ruins! When they get there, they not only find both Robotnik and Knuckles, but a threat they hoped they'd never have to face again! Back in the city, all seems tranquil for the Mayor and Sally, but you know that can't last, and before you know it, Sonic, Tails, and Knuckles are back to try to restore order! What is the mystery that threatens their very existence? Will a cocky hedgehog, a headstrong echidna, and an eager fox be enough to save civilization?

Continuing the special tie-in tales with Sega's mega-successful "Sonic Adventure" Dreamcast Game! "Perfect Chaos": As Super Sonic battles Perfect Chaos, Knuckles and the Freedom Fighters do whatever they can to save those in danger from the raging waters! With Super Sonic weakening, the heroes' only hope is to get to the generator, which is underwater and buried under tons of rubble! Can they reverse the damage and save Super Sonic, or is everyone doomed? Even if they reach the generator, are they prepared for any ramifications their actions may cause?

"The Big Payback": Robotnik is upset by Sonic's victory over "Perfect Chaos" (as seen in the recent Sonic Adventure tie-in issues), so he sicks Silver Sonic II on the blue blur, right as the Freedom Fighters prepare to depart the Hidden City! Joining the battle, Sonic's friends find trying to beat Silver Sonic II in hand-to-hand combat is impossible, only Sonic can withstand Silver Sonic II's blows! The battle is furious, with repercussions sure to impact the future of the Freedom Fighters. What lies in store for the fearless heroes, and is there a way to defeat the juggernaut that is Silver Sonic II? As always, can Robotnik be far behind?

"Heart of the Hedgehog": Part 1? After the Freedom Fighter Special makes a crash landing, Sonic and Tails perform a little reconnaissance and find themselves up against the menace of Metal Sonic! Plus: "Picking Up the Pieces" by Ken Penders, Steven Butler, and Pam Eklund: Knuckles begins his quest to learn the fate of the Floating Island and all who lived upon it!
name: Heart of the Hedgehog, Part 1 "Evil's Return"

description: HEART OF THE HEDGEHOG: Part 2? The heat is on, literally!? as Sonic desperately tries to save Tails, trapped inside the rim of a volcano by the menacing Metal Sonic! Rescuing his little buddy will be harder than usual... as the new, sentient version of Metal Sonic knows no limits in his hatred of Sonic, and will stop at nothing to ruin his world! All the more frightening since he's faster and stronger than before! It's Sonic's biggest challenge yet, courtesy of friendly neighborhood, long-time Spider-Man editor, Danny Fingeroth, making his debut his as a Sonic scribe! Plus: Last month, we revealed the tragic origin of Monkey Khan and the sinister part Doctor Robotnik played in his creation. Now it is the present, and Robotnik has Monkey Khan within his grasp again. Can Mobius survive if Robotnik's greatest creation is once again programmed for evil?! Find out in "Against a Haunted Past" Part 2 by Frank Strom and Harvey Mercadoocasio.

"Family Matters": Sonic, Princess Sally, and the gang return to Knothole to find the kingdom in complete and utter turmoil! Prince Elias has been captured by Shadow-Bots who intend to roboticize him, and Queen Alicia undergoes a surgical operation to determine her fate once and for all, while King Max insists on storming Doctor Robotnik's HQ with his troops in order to save his son! As if all that isn't bad enough, Sonic must also confront his Uncle Chuck who is under Robotnik's control! Also, Knuckles stars in "The Road To Albion" Part 1 by Ken Penders, Steven Butler, and Pam Eklund: Knuckles finds himself drifting alone amid the raging waters after an energy wave sets off a massive explosion in Haven. Surrounded by nothingness, the ghostly image of his ancestor Althair appears to guide him on a journey to Albion, a journey not only of discovery but possible redemption and restoration. Will Knuckles finally be able to set things straight?
name: Negative Relations

description: "Thicker Than Water": Our heroes deal with the disastrous results of last issue's major turmoil, and in the process face their own inner turmoil as well. Princess Sally is among the hardest hit, keeping a vigil for her ailing father, King Max ? while Sonic blames himself for King Max's condition. Meanwhile, Robotnik has returned to see the damage his headquarters has suffered, and you can bet he's not very happy! Marshaling forces of Shadow Bots and Robians, he plots his revenge, even as Sonic ponders the Sword of Acorns' alleged ability to restore the Robians' own free will! Also: In another thrilling Knuckles back-up story, Knuckles and friends return to Albion, where many surprises await them ? including Antoine discovering his father there!
name: Besiged

description: A sword-wielding Sonic undertakes an unauthorized solo mission to free the Robians, and is surprised to find an unwanted ally in the form of Mina the mongoose. Things really get hectic when both find themselves under attack from new, upgraded versions of Robotnik's Com-Bots! Meanwhile, Princess Sally and Prince Elias become reacquainted with their mother, Queen Alicia, and King Max receives crippling news. All this, plus Rotor the walrus returns! Also, in another thrilling Knuckles back-up story, Knuckles and his friends learn some heartbreaking realities on Albion, and find themselves having to choose between the lesser of two evils in a story appropriately titled, "Between a Rock and a Hard Place." Written by Ken Penders, with art by Steven Butler and Pam Eklund.

Sonic has prevented the Sword of Acorns from falling into Doctor Robotnik's clutches, but now it's in the hands of the notorious Kodos, Mobotropolis' former warlord. As if the situation wasn't bad enough, when some unexpected visitors arrive at Doctor Robotnik's doorstep asking for aid, it's up to Sonic to talk them out of such a hasty decision. But why aren't they willing to listen to him?
name: Crash!

description: Sonic returns to Knothole and finds himself in hot water because of the missing Sword of Acorns. Angered by the frosty reception, he hastily leaves with Tails, Rotor and Mina. Sonic blames himself and can't stop thinking about the Sword. Robotnik is also angry over the lost Sword of Acorns, terrified it will get in rebel hands and actually restore free will to those he's imprisoned. The facts don't stop Robotnik, however, he pretends to have the Sword in a nefarious plot to hoodwink the newly arrived Overlanders.
name: Crime 'n Punishment

description: "New Order 2": As beautiful as the new Knothole Village is, Sonic just can't adjust to it knowing that Robotnik's presence ? and that of the Overlanders ? persists in Robotropolis. For his part, Elias has chosen the path of peace, electing to focus on turning Knothole into a permanent habitat rather than trying to reclaim Robotropolis. By issue's end, however, dark alliances shall be made and peril shall befall the Freedom Fighters ? in the form of both natural disasters and wicked enemies! It isn't long before Sonic gets a chance to switch back to "hero" mode!
name: New Order

description: "Enemy Mine": A trip to Robotropolis to rescue the roboticized Overlanders baffles Sonic and Bunnie, as many of the Overlanders haven't even been roboticized! Meanwhile, Kodos has gone over the top, affected by radiation, leading Sonic and Bunnie to assist Arachnis in battle against Kodos as they attempt to make their way through the Great Forest. Is Kodos condition part of a bigger threat? Can Arachnis be trusted? And just what can Robotnik be up to by allowing the Overlanders to exist free of roboticization? The intrigue is enough to make a hedgehog hang up his sneakers, but our hero will soldier on! Plus, another thrilling back-up story featuring the ever popular Knuckles the Echidna! "Chosen One": His fellow echidnas may not have the answers to Knuckles' problem, but Athair believes he does, and recruits Tails, along with Merlin Prower, to assist with the solution, leading to the moment fans have been anxiously waiting... and enthusiastically asking... for ?? the ultimate destiny of Sonic's major domo revealed!

"My Secret Identity": Geoffrey manages to piece together half of Uncle Chuck's message from the damaged Shadow-Bot, and he and his secret service team embark on a mission to Robotropolis to retrieve it. Meanwhile, an incognito Sonic begins his quest for Arachnis and Tails, but is sidetracked by Geoffrey's mission. The intrigue thickens when both the secret service and Sonic are captured by Overlanders, and Sonic does his best to maintain his anonymity in the midst of his cellmates. Can Sonic aid in their escape without blowing his cover? All this plus surprising, unexpected revelations about Robotnik and Tails! And what's with all the missing Overlanders? PLUS!: Another thrilling Knuckles back-up story by Ken Penders and Ron Lim, this time guest-starring everyone's favorite, Sonic's buddy Tails!

"Blow By Blow": This thrill-a-minute issue is not to be missed! After returning to Knothole, Geoffrey informs Elias that Robotnik still has robotization on his mind. Sally disguises herself as a servant and manages to sneak out of Castle Acorn in order to go see Sonic, but Sonic has his hands full trying to stay incognito while he continues his quest for Arachnis and the Sword ? not to mention Mina, Sally's latest rival for Sonic's affections! The intrigue never ends in a plot where Kodos, Doctor Quack, Tails, Nate, Elias and Knuckles all play a part! And just like the previous issue ? what's with all the missing Overlanders? PLUS!: Another thrilling Knuckles back-up story by Ken Penders and Ron Lim, guest-starring Tails!
name: Blow by Blow

description: "Blow By Blow"?? This thrill-a-minute issue is not to be missed! After returning to Knothole, Geoffrey informs Elias that Robotnik still has robotization on his mind. Sally disguises herself as a servant and manages to sneak out of Castle Acorn in order to go see Sonic, but Sonic has his hands full trying to stay incognito while he continues his quest for Arachnis and the Sword ? not to mention Mina, Sally's latest rival for Sonic's affections! The intrigue never ends in a plot where Kodos, Doctor Quack, Tails, Nate, Elias and Knuckles all play a part! And just like the previous issue ?? what's with all the missing Overlanders? Plus, another thrilling Knuckles back-up story, this time guest-starring everyone's favorite, Sonic's buddy Tails, by Ken Penders and artist Ron Lim!

This is it! The one for which fans have been waiting! The senses-shattering 100th issue of Sonic! In "Reunion," Sonic and Princess Sally reunite for the first time since Sonic was divested of his knighthood... but it's not quite what the heroic hedgehog had in mind! Ironically, it all takes place in that mechanized metropolis of Robotropolis, but that's not the most shocking surprise: the bittersweet reunion is made even more so by the loss of one of Knothole's own! It's a milestone story not to be missed! Plus, another thrilling Knuckles back-up story by Ken Penders! The recent exploits and intrigue of everyone's favorite echidna collide in one combustible story, as Knuckles faces off against Dimitri and the Dark Legion! The fate of literally everyone on Mobius hangs in the balance, not to mention Knuckles' family and friends, helplessly trapped in another zone!

After the catastrophic events of the epic Sonic #100, Sonic and his friends find themselves living in a world that bears no resemblance to the one they've always known. Who ? or what?! ? is responsible? Also, Knuckles stars in "Replacing Reality" (by Ken Penders): Can it be so? Has Knuckles aligned himself with Dimitri and the Dark Legion? And can he really be serious about reversing history without considering the repercussions? Could it possibly tie in to the intrigue Sonic and his friends have recently found themselves in?! Plus, Beginning a new feature highlighting characters, objects and events that have shaped the Sonicverse!

"Freedom Fighters of the Galaxy" Part One: A tribute to the Guardians of the Galaxy, brought to you by the team that most recently brought us their exploits, writer Mike Gallagher and artist Jim Valentino! In an alternate future, Sonic comes back to Mobius after being in space for a thousand years to find the planet in worse shape than when he left it. Teaming up with the decedents of the original Freedom Fighters, our heroes combat an evil so great, they wish the original Robotnik was back! Plus: The return of the Downunda Freedom Fighters, squaring off against the Bunyip in a tale recalling the early days of the Sonic comic series by Mike Gallagher, Dave Manak, and Harvo.

Alternate reality Sonic gets blasted away for thousand years by Robotnik. With Robnik having an advantage he destroyed Mobius leaving it now just husk shell its remains. Sonic and the descendents Freedom Fighters protect of what remains of their galaxy.

The other story is the origin of the Downunda Freedom Fighters and their search for replacement for Walt Wallaby when he is away at Acorn Secret Service.
name: Quantum Leap

first_appearance_teams.name: The Freedom Fighters of the Galaxy

team_credits.name: The Freedom Fighters of the Galaxy

description:
"Freedom Fighters of the Galaxy" Part Two: The tribute to the guardians of the galaxy continues! Sonic's troubles in the alternate future version of Mobius go from bad to worse, as the harbinger of doom arrives... and his name is Silver Snively! That can only mean one thing: his master, the incarnation of doom itself, can't be far behind... none other than Robolactus! Can Sonic and the future Freedom Fighters stop this menace before he has a chance to erase them from the history books? Plus "The Return of Downunda Freedom Fighters" Part Two (by Mike Gallagher & Dave Manak): a continuation of the confrontation begun last issue, as the Downunda's Freedom Fighters square off against the Bunyip in a classic-style Sonic tale!

One story dealing with a what if alternate universe of the sonic characters where sonic was blast away 1000 years . The other story is the Downunda Freedom Fighters without their teammate Walt Wallaby. Both are continuations of Sonic the Hedgehog issue #104.

first_appearance_teams.name: The Freedom Fighters of the Galaxy

team_credits.name: The Freedom Fighters of the Galaxy

description: "Freedom Fighters of the Galaxy" Part Two: The tribute to the guardians of the galaxy continues! Sonic's troubles in the alternate future version of Mobius go from bad to worse, as the harbinger of doom arrives... and his name is Silver Snively! That can only mean one thing: his master, the incarnation of doom itself, can't be far behind... none other than Robolactus! Can Sonic and the future Freedom Fighters stop this menace before he has a chance to erase them from the history books? Plus "The Return of Downunda Freedom Fighters" Part Two (by Mike Gallagher & Dave Manak): a continuation of the confrontation begun last issue, as the Downunda's Freedom Fighters square off against the Bunyip in a classic-style Sonic tale!

"Crouching Hedgehog, Hidden Dragon" Part One: Princess Sally, Knothole Village's first ambassador, is sent on her first mission as an envoy of peace to the rest of Mobius. Sonic and the Freedom Fighters join her on her trek to The Hidden City of the Ancients. Before talks can commence, however, the Ancients ask the FF to help with a small problem they're having: A Fire-Breathing Dragon! PLUS: Knuckles in Part One of "Reunification" (by Ken Penders): A mysterious echidna appears on the Floating Island. Rather than finding Knuckles, they find a place inhabited by The Dark Legion. Who is this echidna and what does it have to do with Knuckles? Featuring a pulse-pounding cover by fan-favorite SPAZ!

two stories in this issue.

1) Crouching Hedgehog Hidden Dragon: Freedom Fighters meet with the people from station square in order to give homes to refugees they must deal with a dragon problem.

2) Reunification: knuckles alied with dark legion to deal with his new powers. A mysterious time traveler comes in in order to find a trator
name: Dragon's Lair

description:
"Crouching Hedgehog, Hidden Dragon" Part Two: Things are heating up, as Sonic continues defending the Hidden City of the Ancients from the dragon that besieged it last issue! Meanwhile, the rest of the Freedom Fighters do their best to keep damage to a minimum ? both to building and the citizenry, whose alliance the Freedom Fighters are counting on. It's not easy ? someone or something is intent on keeping them from accomplishing their mission. Who could it be?! PLUS: Knuckles stars in "Reunification" Part Two (by Ken Penders & Dawn Best).

Freedom Fighters: joined palidin team sigma alpha to stop dragon named ZIn who turns out to be Dulcy boyfriend.

Reunification: knuckles allied with dark legion to deal with his new powers. A mysterious time traveler comes in order to find a traitor

New Format! Three action-packed stories per issue! "Robotnik X 2 = Trouble" (by Karl Bollers, Ron Lim, Pam Eklund & Andrew Pepoy): If you think you know what the title means, you're right... and you're not! Check it out this mystery, wrapped in a riddle inside an enigma for yourself! Next, Sonic's supporting cast takes the spotlight in "Like a Child Called Hope" (by Karl Bollers & J. Axer): Hope asks for asylum under the Kingdom of Knothole, but after all they've been through, can the Acorns ever trust an Overlander again? Then, Knuckles closes out the action in "Reunification" Part Three (by Ken Penders & Dawn Best): The mysterious new Echidna on the Floating Island is going to great lengths to protect Knuckles... but from whom? Featuring a pulse-pounding cover by fan-favorite SPAZ! an>

"I Herd It Through the Pipeline!" (Benny Lee, Ron, Pam Eklund & Andrew Pepoy): The Freedom Fighters take on their most dangerous mission yet as they travel to the Frozen North Sea to free Rotor's herd from Robotnik's control! They plan on using Sally's mystical Sword of Acorns for the task... but can they make past the Robo-Eels and Ice-Bots alive?! "The Crush" (Karl Bollers & J. Axer): Sally and Mina have it out about Sonic. "Reunification Part Four" (Ken Penders & Dawn Best): The thrilling saga comes to its exciting conclusion. Don't miss the action and intrigue! Featuring a pulse-pounding cover by fan- favorite SPAZ!

Station Square Attacks!" (Benny Lee, Ron Lim, Andrew Pepoy & Pam Eklund): Having analyzed the information given to them by Knothole Kingdom, Station Square's computer system commences to launch a nuclear attack against Robotropolis... putting the environment at great risk! Can Sonic prevent disaster?! "One For All" (Karl Bollers & J. Axer): Princess Sally's connection to the Sword of Acorns is legendary, but its about to take a turn of the most surreal kind! "Ultimate Power Part 1" (Ken Penders & Dawn Best): A brand-new Knuckles epic filled with intrigue! Dimitri discovers he is dying, and schemes to drain the Chaos Force from Knuckles in order to save his life. Lien-da, however, has other plans as she schemes to take control of the Dark Legion for her own purposes. Featuring a pulse-pounding cover by fan-favorite SPAZ!
name: War Games

description: "Kids of the Spider Woman" (Karl Bollers & Ron Lim): Arachnis' offspring, a ninja clan, try to steal the Sword of Acorns from Princess Sally... even if it means murder! Can Sonic reach her before time runs out? It's a web of intrigue you'll want to get snared in! "I'll Shoot the Sheriff" (Bollers, Axer, Eklund , & Pepoy): Action and adventure are the name of the game in this rough-and-tumble story co-starring Rob o' the -Hedge and General D'Coolette, the former high- sheriff of Snottingham. "Ultimate Power, Pt. 2" (by Ken Penders & Dawn Best) The excitement and mystery continue as Knuckles' search for the traitor in the Dark Legion's midst goes on! Featuring a pulse-pounding cover by fan-favorite SPAZ!
name: Enter The Ninjas

description: Featuring the return of fan-favorite artist, Art Mawhineey! "Mistaken Identity Crisis" (script by Benny Lee): Sonic persuades Antoine to pose as a phony villain for him to defeat so he can look good in his father's eyes. But when a real villain knocks out Sonic, Antoine must put his fears behind him and rise to the occasion! Will he be a hero... or a zero? "Unforgiven" (script by Karl Bollers): Uncle Chuck feels guilty for the things he was forced to do under Dr. Robotnik's control. Can others forgive someone when one can't even forgive oneself? Plus: Keep on top of the Sonicverse stats with the latest collection of "Sega Files" by Ken Penders!
name: Antoine The Brave...?

description: "Cry of the Wolf": Last month we said goodbye to Lupe and the Wolfpack. This month, witness how they first met and teamed up with the Freedom Fighters. Adapted from a classic episode of DIC's Saturday morning Sonic animated series, "Cry Of The Wolf" is an issue-length epic that finds the classic incarnation of Sonic and his friends up against the original Dr. Robotnik and Snively, out to unleash their secret weapon! Your quota for excitement begins and ends here! Graphically-enhanced with way-cool computer coloring by Josh and Aimee Ray. Head-spinning cover by Spaz and Ribeiro, with a frontispiece by new fan fave J. Axer!

Mammoth Mogul is back, and he's badder than ever, appearing in not one, but two titanic tales! "Twice Told Tails": In round one, Mammoth tackles Sonic, who is desperate for the answers behind Tails' mysterious affliction. The only problem is, Mammoth won't tell... wait until you see why! "Ultimate Power, Part 1" (by Ken Penders & Dawn Best): Knuckles has been trying to reintegrate Dimitri and the Dark Legion to the rest of echidna society, but that's not easy when Mammoth Mogul pays a visit! Why does current politics in Echidnaopolis interest Mogul? Plus: Amy Rose stars in "School Dazed or Young At Heart" (by Bollers, Axer, & Tomas): Now that things are back to normal at Knothole, everyone has to go to school, including Amy Rose. See how our young heroine deals with the pressures of teachers... and a smart aleck named Tails, sitting right next to her! Features a mega-mayhem cover by Spaz and Ribeiro!

Twice Told Tails: Tails constant nightmares are revealed as sho

Ultimate Power: With Knuckles new found power there is discussion of what to do with the Dark Legion as their leader Dimitri is slowly dieing

Young at Heart: Amy and Sally discuss the need The Freedom Fighters needing to tend school
name: When A Mammoth Returns

description: "Meanie In a Bottle" (by Lee, Art Mawhinney, & Pam Eklund): Sonic and Muttski are playing out by the pond and find something at the bottom of it... a magic lamp with a genie inside. However, this genie is a meanie and gives Muttski Sonic's speed. How will our hero manage when he can't even outrun Antoine? Plus, Knuckles steps in to confront Mammoth Mogul before he destroys his ancient relative and former enemy Dimitri. Ring that bell, the fight's about to begin (by Ken Penders & Dawn Best). And, as a special bonus, the never-before-seen sketchbook of fan-favorite Spaz (aka Patrick Spaziante)! Check out the sketches that bought some of your favorite characters and vehicles to life.

"Operation Off-Switch" (by Bollers, Lim, Pepoy & Eklund): When orbital spy satellites reveal Robotnik rebuilding a new mechanized body amidst the ruins of the ancient, deserted city of Megalopolis, Sonic and Bunnie are recruited to stop him... but can they do so in time?! "Bat Fight" (by Bollers, Axer, & Amash): It seems Sonic and Bunnie are not the only ones the President dispatched to Megalopolis ? Rogue The Bat is there as well! When she confuses Bunnie for a bad guy, all heck breaks loose as our belles battle it out! Plus: Knuckles stars in "Ultimate Power, Midlogue: The Lesson" (by Penders, Lim, & Ray): As Knuckles prepares to face Mammoth Mogul to save his dying ancestor Dimitri, he remembers a time when life was simpler and his father taught him the lessons that would serve him for times like these.

In "Tortoise and the Hedgehog" (by R. Chacon, Art Mawhinney, & Jim Amash), Sonic's childhood friend, Tommy Turtle, hasn't been seen since Dr. Robotnik first took over. Now he's back and already in trouble! Sonic goes to help but finds some old enemies in his way. What's a hero to do? Holy Matrix! See in "CyberRace" (by Benny Lee, Steven Butler, & Jim Amash) what Robotnik and Snively have to do to download to their new bodies after their old ones have been destroyed! Then, check out "Ultimate Power Part 3" (by Ken Penders & Dawn Best) as Knuckles confronts Mammoth Mogul... and Dimitri's life is at stake! Place your bets as the Chaos-infused contest is about to begin! Featuring a rollicking cover by Spaz and Ribeiro!

Robotnik returns? Weren't he & Snively destroyed last issue? Well, unless you missed it you know they downloaded themselves into new bodies. Sonic and the Freedom Fighters are ready to "receive" the fiends but there's an unexpected side effect: Sonic & Tails find they've reversed roles with Robotnik & Snively as they turn mecha and the villains are now human! "Heart to Heart" (by Karl Bollers, Ron Lim, & Pam Eklund): That's exactly what St. John and Hershey have... but can it change decisions they've made that will radically change their lives forever? "Ultimate Power, Part 4" (by Ken Penders & Dawn Best): It's a literal fight to the finish as Knuckles takes on Mammoth Mogul in this climactic battle! Featuring a rollicking cover by Spaz and Ribeiro!

A mammoth snake-like train is ravaging the countryside, destroying everything in it's path-including innocent Mobian Village! Can Sonic and Tails stop this latest version of the Cater Killer in its tracks before the village lies in ruins?! "Dust Bunnie" (by Karl Bollers, Steven Butler, & Jim Amash): It's the chaotic return of Jack Rabbit and his Sand Crew (last seen in Sonic #62), and this time they face heroic Bunnie Rabbot in this thrilling solo adventure! "Time Code" (by Karl Bollers, Art Mawhinney, & Nelson Ribiero): Rotor tries to crack the code to Nicole's early memory banks to find out where she came from, not realizing he wrote the code himself in the future. Comin'-at-ya' cover by Spaz and Ribeiro!

How far will a woman go to get a man's attention? Sonic finds out when love-struck Mina the Mongoose joins the Freedom Fighters! "The Royal Signet" (by Romy Chacon, Art Mawhinney, & Pam Eklund): Princess Sally remembers Julayla, her late mentor, in this heartwarming tale. "In the Beginning..." (by Ken Penders, Dawn Best, & Ken Penders): Julie-Su and Mighty reflect upon the good old days with Knuckles and how they met.

St. John and Hershey have finally tracked Prince Elias Acorn down, but so have Robotnik's forces. "Afterlife, Part 1": Knuckles speaks to his ancestors in the afterlife. "Song Bird": Mina is forced on stage by Sonic, who believes she can sing her heart out.

The Sonic/Mina/Sally triangle comes to a head in this intriguing tale! Sally has been noticing Mina's attraction towards Sonic for many months now... and unfortunately she suspects that the feeling is mutual. Before she can confront them about their relationship, however, bounty hunter extraordinaire, Nack The Weasel kidnaps her! "Afterlife" Part Two (by Ken Penders & Art Mawhinney): This introspective story finds Knuckles pondering the early events of his past ? from his parent's marriage to his infancy. Finally, Julie-Su and Vector the Crocodile have... a heart-to-heart!? Say it ain't so! By Ken Penders & Dawn Best.

Heart Held Hostage part 1: Sally is captured by knack's crew

After life part 2: knuckled meets with Aurora

When There was Only One Guardian: Vector talks with Julie-Sue of his memories with Knuckles and how they became friends.

After Nack the Weasel and his bounty hunter crew kidnap Sally, Sonic and Mina set out to rescue her together. Things get dicey as danger levels get high for the two girls Sonic cares about most in his life. The conclusion to last issue's story will force Sonic to choose between Mina and Sally once and for all in a take that can't be missed! "Afterlife" Part Three (by Penders & Mawhinney): Knuckles continues to reflect upon his past and how he was groomed to become the Guardian of the Floating Island. "The Last Robian" (by Bollers, Mawhinney, & Eklund): A mystery has engulfed the entire planet of Mobius ? all the Roboticized Mobians have disappeared!

Sonic and Mina race to save Sally from Nack and his family.

Also, all of the Robians, the Mobians that Robotnik roboticed have gone missing without a trace...

Aliens known only as the Xorda surround the entire planet of Mobius. This 2-part saga concludes in Sonic #125, the 10th Anniversary issue of the Sonic comic book! PLUS: "Afterlife" (by Ken Penders & Art Mawhinney) the amazing conclusion to this epic tale starring Knuckles the Echidna!

Special 10-Year Anniversary Issue featuring an All-Star Artist Jam! Shadow returned to help in the fight against the alien Xorda who want nothing more than the destruction of Mobius! After reasoning and bargaining fail, the denizens of the planet must band together for their very survival! In the end, a hero will fall and the future of Mobius will be changed forever. Plus, another thrilling Knuckles solo story.

In this special anniversary issue, everyone is ready to take the Xorda in all or nothing brawl to save Mobius! This is also the reveal of Mobius and the Mobians.

Sonic finds himself on a strange planet. While seeking a way home is his priority, his heroic instincts take over as he helps defend an alien race from their aggressors. "Better Read than Dead": Sonic and The Editor face the evil of... Deadline! Can they get the issue done on time before Sonic is erased from existence?
name: Tossed in Space, Part 1: Red Chaos

description: Sonic's space odyssey continues as he crash-lands on a strange planet... a planet that evolves faster than Sonic can even run! What can Sonic do while whole civilizations rise and fall around him!? More importantly, what do the inhabitants of the planet think of our trespassing hedgehog? It's sci-fi with a Sonic spin! PLUS: "Sonicspy vs. Knucklespy" (by Michael Gallagher & Dave Manak): It's "humor in a jugular vein" that will drive you "mad" with laughter as we skewer one of our favorite cartoon strips!
name: Tossed In Space, Part 3: Evo-Solution

description: Sonic hooks up with a fleet of alien mercenary starships, banded together to find and destroy a space being of incredible power that has left a trail of galactic devastation in its wake! It turns out to be a nemesis from Sonic's past, namely E.V.E.! "E.V.E.-Ill": Originally Robotnik's creation, E.V.E. was set free by Sonic way back in issue #22. Now Sonic finds out what she has been doing with that freedom... destroying whole planets. Sonic feels responsible and sets out to find her first. Can he put an end to this "eve of destruction?"
name: Tossed in Space, Part 4: Starmada

description: Move over, NASCAR pros! Sonic is putting the pedal to the metal by entering a racing competition! Then, in "Welcome to Wheelworld" (by Benny Lee, Art Mawhinney, & Michael Higgins), Sonic evaluates the best opportunity for him to get back home to his family and friends.
name: Tossed in Space, Part 6: Space Gamble

description:
Sonic is back from his adventure in outer space just in time, as the Kingdom of Acorn and the Empire of Robotnik are about to collide head-on in their struggle to control Mobius! How will everybody react to Sonic's "return from the dead?" How will Sonic react to all the changes that occurred in his absence?

The Blue Blur returns: Sonic returns to Mobius and learns that one year has past since he left the planet.
name: Home - Part 1 of 4

description: Two titanic stories in one action-packed issue! "Home-The Gathering" Part Two (of Four): Continuing the four-part epic begun last issue! The threat of nuclear annihilation by Dr. Robotnik and his new minions looms large, so Sonic and the citizens of the Kingdome of Acorn and Station Square must ready themselves to strike the Eggman Empire before it's too late! Plus: "Mobius: 25 Years Later" a far-flung-futuristic feature that fast-forwards you to the future of our favorite characters and their kids!
name: Home - Part 2 of 4

description: Sonic, Knuckles, and the entire Kingdom of Acorn launch a two-pronged defense against the forces of Eggman's Empire. As usual, Dr. Robotnik (a.k.a. Eggman) has a few tricks up his sleeve to keep his foes from winning the day. And then there's Shadow and a stash of deadly weapons... "Mobius: 25 Years Later?The Unveiling": Our popular look at the future lives of Sonic's friends and foes continues! This time, Lara-Su undergoes the female echidna coming-of-age ceremony. As Knuckles' daughter, this is a very big deal ? everyone on the island is invited. Will Lara- Su be able to deal with her insecurities? Also, if he's not here for the ceremony, just why has Rotor come to see Knuckles?! You won't want to miss this intriguing installment by Ken Penders and Steven Butler!
name: Home - Part 3 of 4

description: The final chapter of Sonic's eventful homecoming! His family and friends thought he was dead, but now he's back ? and in the fight of his life with Robotnik's mysterious henchman, uh, woman, Mecha! Are the Mobians in danger of losing Sonic again?! Meanwhile, Knuckles and the Freedom Fighters make their final stand against the Warbots on the wasteland in front of Robotropolis! Also: "Mobius, 25 Years Later" (by Ken Penders with Steven Butler) continues with future Knuckles and Rotor having a serious summit over developments on the planet!
name: Home - Part 4 of 4

description:
The poignant aftermath to this epic tale's climactic finale. With the present crisis abated last issue, Sonic finally has the chance to catch up to those near and dear to him, especially one Princess Sally Acorn. Also: "In Transit" (by Ken Penders, Steven Butler, & Ken Penders): the "Mobius, 25 Years Later" series continues as Lord Rotor returns to the Kingdom of Knothole, while Knuckles consults with the Brotherhood of Guardians at Haven II.

This is issue is well known as The Slap. This is includes guest cameos from Fleetway's "Sonic the Comic" characters.
name: Home, Epilogue: Say You Will

description: Three titanic tales in one issue! "Anonymous"!: Dr. Robotnik has a new enemy to contend with, and it isn't Sonic! This enemy has left a special present for Robotnik and signed it... you guessed it... 'Anonymous!' Also: "Agent from K.N.O.T.H.O.L.E." (by Romy Chacon, Ron Lim, & Nelson Ribeiro): Sonic receives a mysterious message prompting him to travel incognito to meet someone in the middle of the Eggman Empire... someone who should be dead! Can this be a trap? Plus: "Dealing With the Devil" (by Ken Penders & Steven Butler): The next exciting installment of our popular series of tales depicting "Mobius: 25 Years Later" continues!
name: The Tommy Trilogy, Part One: Agent of K.N.O.T.H.O.L.E.

description: Sonic looks forward to a well-needed rest after a strenuous, nerve-racking adventure, but gets anything but rest! As he sleeps, his life is in grave danger, and his father, Jules Hedgehog, does what any father would ? at a heavy price! Also: Knuckles stars in "Patience" (by Romy Chacon, Ron Lim, & Nelson Ribeiro): Knuckles decides to disobey the King and take matters into his own hands by freeing Angel Island on his own. Will his lack of patience be his own downfall? Plus: "Girl Talk" (by Ken Penders, Steven Butler, & Jim Amash): The latest in a series of tales depicting "Mobius: 25 Years Later" finds Queen Sally and Julie-Su trying to figure out a way for their husbands and kids to get along during an upcoming visit. Easier said than done!
name: The Tommy Trilogy, Part Two: The Infiltrator

description: Without the consent of the King, Sonic and the Freedom Fighters infiltrate the center of the Eggman Empire deep in the technological monstrosity of Megapolis. However, they are not there to take down Robotnik's latest scheme but rather to save a friend. (by Romy Chacon, Steven Butler, & Jim Amash) "Trouble in Paradise": The popular "Mobius, 25 Years Later" saga continues! King Sonic, Queen Sally and their kids make the journey to visit Knuckles, Julie-Su and Lara-Su on Angel Island... but some of them are not happy with it! Is there trouble in paradise? (by Ken Penders) "One Part Oh-la-la, Two Parts Treachery" starring Antoine: As Antoine gets ready for his new assignment, he remembers a simpler time dealing with the loves of his life. It's a lesson in romance he has never forgotten. But will it help him now?
name: The Tommy Trilogy, Part Three: Robo-Dyne Systems

description: Sonic, Knuckles, and the Chaotix go back to the magical island to find it a far worse place than last seen. Overrun by Robotnik, Dingo's and the Dark Legion, one can only wonder: have the Guardians faltered, and can the island ever be the same?! Find out in this epic tale! "My Dinner with Sonic" (by Ken Penders, Steven Butler, & Jim Amash): The popular "Mobius, 25 Years Later" saga continues! When old friendly nemeses sit down for what's supposed to be a cordial meal, it seems like there's less humble pie on the menu than steamed egos!
name: Return to Angel Island, Part 1: The Message

description: Sonic, Knuckles, and The Chaotix not only go face-to-face with the deadly Dark Legion, but must contend with a slew of old and new faces as well! The action never lets up in this frantic tale! "Slumber Party" (by Penders, Butler, & Amash): The popular "Mobius, 25 Years Later" saga continues! Lara-Su, Sonia and a couple of Lara-Su's friends have a sleepover while Sonic and Sally are on Angel Island. Naturally, Manik can't help but make a pest of himself. Meanwhile, more hints of the approaching danger are revealed!
name: Return to Angel Island, Part 2: The Avatar

description: The struggle to free Angel Island from the Evil Dr. Robotnik and protect the Master Emerald continues! Can Sonic, Knuckles, and The Chaotix stand together, or will their petty differences divide them? Meanwhile, the fate of the Guardians hangs in the balance! "A Difference of Opinion" (by Ken Penders, Steven Butler, & Jim Amash): When King Sonic and the Guardian Knuckles have a late night discussion of the possible end of Mobius, much of the "past" is revealed in the future! Don't miss their surprising predictions in this far-flung tale!
name: Return to Angel Island, Part 3: How Many Echidnas Does It Take To Protect the Master Emerald?

description:
Overview

Still trying to generate publicity (and cash) from her purloined alien egg, Stella Stargaze teams up with media sleazehound Hidalgo Romero to try to get a big payoff for staging an alien birth on live T. V. in "The Egg And I".  When jealous Romero cuts the strap of her gown on the air,  T.C. Fremont begins to see the real Stella (and so do millions of viewers! ). Guess starring Janis Lawson. Meanwhile, Alizarin Crimson's attack last issue has left Nightveil her helpless prisoner, and Crimson in possession of her Cloak Of Darkness. And Rad starts a riot in a disco, while Colt wonders why she ever got mixed up in all this. 
 
Story and inks by Bill Black, and pencils by Darren Goodhart.  
 
The back-up, "Terror At The Top Of The World" has Tara and Janis on the trail of the evil Doctor Randolph Rivits. They run afoul of his twisted daughter, Roxanne. 
 
Script and inks by Bill Black, with pencils by Marc Hempel (Mars). This is a reworked version of a story that originally ran in the Paragon Pubs book, Tara On The Dark Continent, in 1976.  
 
Finally, Dragonfly is trapped in an alien dimension, bereft of her powers, in a story that ties into the last issue of her own book (#8) and the first issue of Fem Fantastique.
 
Story and pencils by Rik Levins, inks by Bill Black.
name: The Egg and I

description:
Overview

Without her bond to Joan Wayne, She-Cat is becoming increasingly more unstable and cat-like. Tom Kelly pays a visit to Jennifer Wayne-Burke,  to suggest that she replace her mother as a government /sponsored paranormal. Rad returns home to her old stomping grounds, to find Tara laying in wait to ambush her, and somehow, that vigilante-turned-madman the Black Commando is free. When Nightveil appears before the strung-out Claudette Meyler (She-Cat bond), it is as the mindless puppet of Alizarin Crimson. And no matter how big her guns are, Colt can do nothing to solve any of these crisis. 
 
Guest starring David Burke and Jason Burke. 
 
"Step Out And Away", written by Wes Covington, drawn by Don Secrease, and inked by John Dell and Bill Koch.
name: Step Out and Away
